intro: Phyteuma spicatum subsp. coeruleum, commonly known as blue phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces showy, bell-shaped blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
